C

convolution - package convolution
This package was created using MATLAB Builder JA.
Convolution - Class in convolution
The Convolution class provides a Java interface to the M-functions from the files: C:\\Users\\user\\Desktop\\Java\\Matlab\\Projects\\convolution.m The Convolution.dispose() method must be called on a Convolution instance when it is no longer needed to ensure that native resources allocated by this class are properly freed.
Convolution() - Constructor for class convolution.Convolution
Constructs a new instance of the Convolution class.
Convolution(String) - Constructor for class convolution.Convolution
Deprecated.
Please use the constructor Convolution.Convolution(MWComponentOptions componentOptions). The com.mathworks.toolbox.javabuilder.MWComponentOptions class provides API to set the path to the component.
Convolution(MWComponentOptions) - Constructor for class convolution.Convolution
Constructs a new instance of the Convolution class.
convolution(List, List) - Method in class convolution.Convolution
Provides the interface for calling the convolution M-function where the first input, an instance of List, receives the output of the M-function and the second input, also an instance of List, provides the input to the M-function.
convolution(Object[], Object[]) - Method in class convolution.Convolution
Provides the interface for calling the convolution M-function where the first input, an Object array, receives the output of the M-function and the second input, also an Object array, provides the input to the M-function.
convolution(int, Object...) - Method in class convolution.Convolution
Provides the standard interface for calling the convolution M-function with 3 input arguments.
convolution(int, Object...) - Method in interface convolution.ConvolutionRemote
Provides the standard interface for calling the convolution M-function with 3 input arguments.
ConvolutionMCRFactory - Class in convolution
INTERNAL USE ONLY
ConvolutionRemote - Interface in convolution
The ConvolutionRemote class provides a Java RMI-compliant interface to the M-functions from the files: C:\\Users\\user\\Desktop\\Java\\Matlab\\Projects\\convolution.m The dispose() method must be called on a ConvolutionRemote instance when it is no longer needed to ensure that native resources allocated by this class are properly freed, and the server-side proxy is unexported.

D

dispose() - Method in class convolution.Convolution
Frees native resources associated with this object
dispose() - Method in interface convolution.ConvolutionRemote
Frees native resources associated with the remote server object
disposeAllInstances() - Static method in class convolution.Convolution
Calls dispose method for each outstanding instance of this class.
